questions.question: In Standard normal distribution, the value of mode is ___________?

explanations.a: In a standard normal distribution, the value of mean is 0 and in normal distribution mean and mode coincide.
explanations.b: In a standard normal distribution, the value of mean is 0 and in normal distribution mean and mode coincide.
explanations.d: In a standard normal distribution, the value of mean is 0 and in normal distribution mean and mode coincide.

questions.question: Let $X \sim N(2, 4)$ and $Y \sim N(3, 9)$ be two independent Gaussian random variables. What is the distribution of $Z = X + Y$?

explanations.a: Correct! The mean is $E[Z] = E[X] + E[Y] = 2 + 3 = 5$, and the variance is $Var(Z) = Var(X) + Var(Y) = 4 + 9 = 13$.
explanations.b: Incorrect variance; check the sum of variances.
explanations.d: Incorrect, variance does not add up properly.

questions.question: Let $X \sim N(\mu_X, \Sigma_X)$ be a bivariate Gaussian random vector, where $\mu_X = \begin{bmatrix} 0 \\ 1 \end{bmatrix}$ and $\Sigma_X = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0.5 \\ 0.5 & 2 \end{bmatrix}$. Find the conditional distribution of $X_1$ given $X_2 = 1$.

explanations.a: Correct! Using the conditional distribution formula for multivariate Gaussian random variables, the mean and variance of $X_1 | X_2 = 1$ are $\mu_1 + \Sigma_{12}\Sigma_{22}^{-1}(x_2 - \mu_2)$ and $\Sigma_{11} - \Sigma_{12}\Sigma_{22}^{-1}\Sigma_{21}$, respectively.
explanations.b: Incorrect! You may have made a mistake in the calculation of the conditional mean.
explanations.c: Incorrect! You might have miscalculated the variance.
explanations.d: Incorrect! Both the mean and variance are not correct.

questions.question: Suppose $X \sim N(\mu_X, \Sigma_X)$ is a Gaussian random vector in $\mathbb{R}^2$, where $\Sigma_X = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0.7 \\ 0.7 & 1 \end{bmatrix}$. What is the correlation coefficient $\rho(X_1, X_2)$?

explanations.a: Correct! The correlation coefficient is given by $\rho(X_1, X_2) = \frac{\Sigma_{12}}{\sqrt{\Sigma_{11}\Sigma_{22}}}$, which equals 0.7 in this case.
explanations.b: Incorrect! The correlation coefficient is less than 1.
explanations.c: Incorrect! You squared the covariance value.
explanations.d: Incorrect! The covariance value is higher.

questions.question: A random variable $X$ follows a standard normal distribution $N(0, 1)$. What is $P(-1 \leq X \leq 1)$?

explanations.a: Correct! For a standard normal distribution $N(0, 1)$, about 68% of the data lies within one standard deviation from the mean.
explanations.b: Incorrect, this is the probability for two standard deviations.
explanations.c: This is incorrect; the value is higher.
explanations.d: This corresponds to three standard deviations, not one.

questions.question: Given the cumulative distribution function (CDF) of the standard normal distribution, what is the value of $\lim_{x \to \infty} \Phi(x)$ and $\lim_{x \to -\infty} \Phi(x)$?

explanations.a: Correct! The CDF of a standard normal distribution converges to 1 as $x$ approaches infinity and converges to 0 as $x$ approaches negative infinity.
explanations.b: Incorrect! This reverses the behavior of the CDF for positive and negative infinity.
explanations.c: Incorrect! The CDF does not converge to 0.5 at either extreme.
explanations.d: Incorrect! The values are not valid for a CDF.

questions.question: What is the value of the CDF of the standard normal distribution at $x = 0$?

explanations.a: Correct! By symmetry, the standard normal distribution has a mean of 0, so $\Phi(0) = 0.5$.
explanations.b: Incorrect! The CDF of a normal distribution at the mean is always 0.5.
explanations.c: Incorrect! This value would be at positive infinity, not at 0.
explanations.d: Incorrect! The CDF cannot take negative values.
